alert.note: Alert for McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:36PM CDT until June 12 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Hill, Limestone and McLennan. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West, Mart, Hubbard, Leroy, Mount Calm, Malone, Penelope, Birome, Axtell, Watt, Tours, Prairie Hill and Wiggins.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
